contextId.information: Since the shepherds were speaking to one another, languages that have inclusive forms for "we" and "us" should use the inclusive form here. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])
Jesus was including Peter and John when he said "we." Peter and John would be part of the group of the disciples that would eat the meal. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])
contextId.quote: so that we may eat it

contextId.information: "Herod sent Jesus to return to us." The word "us" refers to Pilate, his soldiers, the priests and scribes, and everyone who was listening to Pilate. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])
contextId.quote: he sent him back to us
